ESB Frame Examples

Default Example

This is the simplest example

				
<div data-esb-frame="http://example.com"></div>

Responsive Example

This is how to display the same page at multiple viewports to get a side-by-side responsive comparison.

				
<div 	data-esb-frame="http://eightshapes.com" 
	data-esb-viewport-width="320" 
	data-esb-height="300" 
	data-esb-scale="0.25" 
	data-esb-title="iPhone"></div>

<div 	data-esb-frame="http://eightshapes.com" 
	data-esb-viewport-width="768" 
	data-esb-height="300" 
	data-esb-scale="0.25" 
	data-esb-title="iPad"></div>

<div 	data-esb-frame="http://eightshapes.com" 
	data-esb-viewport-width="1600" 
	data-esb-height="300" 
	data-esb-scale="0.25" 
	data-esb-title="Desktop"></div>

Gallery Example, Unloads when not visible

This is how to display multiple pages side-by-side

This is also an example of unloading the Frames when they're no longer viewable. This can be useful if a Frame contains video or other rendering-intensive content that you want to prevent when the Frame is not visible.

				
<div 	data-esb-frame="frame_local_pages/local1.html" 
	data-esb-scale="0.57" 
	data-esb-overlay="false" 
	data-esb-unload-when-not-visible="true"></div>
	
<div 	data-esb-frame="frame_local_pages/local2.html" 
	data-esb-scale="0.57" 
	data-esb-overlay="false"
	data-esb-unload-when-not-visible="true"></div>

Device Examples

Frame has built-in shortcuts for displaying pages as they would appear on various devices. Use the data-esb-viewport-device attribute to have your Frame sized to match a device.

You can also wrap the Frame with a wireframed representation of the device by using data-esb-device-frame="true" 

	
<div data-esb-frame="http://eightshapes.com" data-esb-viewport-device="iphone-6" data-esb-scale="0.75"></div>
<div data-esb-frame="http://eightshapes.com" data-esb-viewport-device="iphone-6" data-esb-scale="0.75" data-esb-device-frame="true"></div>

Device Orientation

The device's orientation can also be set to landscape using data-esb-viewport-device-orientation="landscape" 

	
<div data-esb-frame="http://eightshapes.com" 
     data-esb-viewport-device="galaxy-s6" 
     data-esb-scale="0.75" 
     data-esb-viewport-device-orientation="landscape"></div>

<div data-esb-frame="http://eightshapes.com" 
     data-esb-viewport-device="galaxy-s6" 
     data-esb-scale="0.75" 
     data-esb-viewport-device-orientation="landscape"
     data-esb-device-frame="true"></div>

Browser UI

To add a more true-to-life feel, you can reduce the viewport by the amount of screen real estate each device's browser ui uses. Set data-esb-show-browser-ui="true" to enable this feature.

NOTE: the browser ui size is based on the browser ui size after the device has been scrolled. 

	
<div data-esb-frame="http://eightshapes.com" 
     data-esb-viewport-device="iphone-4" 
     data-esb-scale="0.75" 
     data-esb-device-frame="true" 
     data-esb-show-browser-ui="true"></div>

<div data-esb-frame="http://eightshapes.com" 
     data-esb-viewport-device="nexus-10" 
     data-esb-scale="0.5" 
     data-esb-device-frame="true" 
     data-esb-viewport-device-orientation="landscape" 
     data-esb-show-browser-ui="true"></div>

On Page Config Example

Use on page config to wrap certain viewers with options that you don't want to apply to other viewers

				
<h4>360px wide, hide dimensions annotation</h4>
<div data-esb-frame-config="" data-esb-dimensions="false" data-esb-width="360">
	<div data-esb-frame="http://eightshapes.com"></div>
	<div data-esb-frame="http://eightshapes.com/blog/2013/09/25/responsive-grid-behaviors/"></div>
	<div data-esb-frame="http://eightshapes.com/blog/2013/09/25/maintaining-trust-in-coworking-settings/"></div>
</div>

<h4>200px wide</h4>
	<div data-esb-frame="http://eightshapes.com"></div>
	<div data-esb-frame="http://eightshapes.com/blog/2013/09/25/responsive-grid-behaviors/"></div>
	<div data-esb-frame="http://eightshapes.com/blog/2013/09/25/maintaining-trust-in-coworking-settings/"></div>
</div>

360px wide, hide dimensions annotation

200px wide

Triggering loading and unloading of iFrames manually

There is an event-based API to control the loading and unloading of Frame iframes.

  1. Find the UUID of the Frame you want to load/unload
  2. Trigger a custom event on the document using that UUID to invoke the action
				
<div class="wrapper-element">
	<div data-esb-frame="http://example.com"></div>
	<a href="#link" id="unload-iframe-link" class="btn btn-danger">Unload this Frame</a>
	<a href="#link" id="load-iframe-link" class="btn">Load this Frame</a>
</div>	

<!-- First Script Example, Javascript only, see jQuery Example below -->
<script>
	var unload_link = document.getElementById('unload-iframe-link');
	var load_link = document.getElementById('load-iframe-link');

	unload_link.addEventListener('click', function(){
		// The Frame is a sibling of the links in this example
		// Iterate over the siblings until the Frame is found (contains a data-esb-uuid attribute)
		var el = this,
			uuid = false,
			siblings = Array.prototype.filter.call(el.parentNode.children, function(child){
		  		return child !== el;
			});


		Array.prototype.forEach.call(siblings, function(el, i){
			if (el.getAttribute('data-esb-uuid') !== null) {
				uuid = el.getAttribute('data-esb-uuid');
			}
		});

		// Once the uuid is found, dispatch a custom event called 'unload-esb-frame-[uuid]'
		if (uuid) {
			if (window.CustomEvent) {
			  var event = new CustomEvent('unload-esb-frame-' + uuid);
			} else {
			  var event = document.createEvent('CustomEvent');
			  event.initCustomEvent('unload-esb-frame-' + uuid, true, true);
			}

			document.dispatchEvent(event);
		}
	});

	load_link.addEventListener('click', function(){
		// The Frame is a sibling of the links in this example
		// Iterate over the siblings until the Frame is found (contains a data-esb-uuid attribute)
		var el = this,
			uuid = false,
			siblings = Array.prototype.filter.call(el.parentNode.children, function(child){
		  		return child !== el;
			});


		Array.prototype.forEach.call(siblings, function(el, i){
			if (el.getAttribute('data-esb-uuid') !== null) {
				uuid = el.getAttribute('data-esb-uuid');
			}
		});

		// Once the uuid is found, dispatch a custom event called 'unload-esb-frame-[uuid]'
		if (uuid) {
			if (window.CustomEvent) {
			  var event = new CustomEvent('load-esb-frame-' + uuid);
			} else {
			  var event = document.createEvent('CustomEvent');
			  event.initCustomEvent('load-esb-frame-' + uuid, true, true);
			}

			document.dispatchEvent(event);
		}
	});
</script>	

<!-- Second Script Example, jQuery, identical result to above example -->
<script>
	$(document).ready(function(){
		$("#unload-iframe-link").on("click", function(){
			var uuid = $(this).siblings().filter("[data-esb-uuid]").attr("data-esb-uuid");
			$('body').trigger('unload-esb-frame-' + uuid);
		});

		$("#load-iframe-link").on("click", function(){
			var uuid = $(this).siblings().filter("[data-esb-uuid]").attr("data-esb-uuid");
			$(document).trigger('load-esb-frame-' + uuid);
		});
		
	});
</script>
Unload this Frame Load this Frame
